quiz.title: Unit 4: Revenue & Profit Analysis (Quiz 6)
quiz.subtitle: AP Microeconomics — Total Revenue, Profit, and Marginal Revenue
quiz.subject: AP Microeconomics
quiz.topic: Revenue Calculations, Profit Maximization, Marginal Revenue, Shutdown Rule, Cost-Revenue Relationship

questions.question: In the table, when Q = 1, Total Revenue (TR) = A. What is A?
When Q = 1, Profit (π) = B. What is B?
Marginal Revenue (MR) from Q = 0 to Q = 1 is C. What is C?
MR from Q = 1 to Q = 2 is D. What is D?
When Q = 3, Profit (π) = E. What is E?
At Q = 4, Total Revenue (TR) = F. What is F?
At Q = 5, Total Revenue (TR) = I. What is I?
In perfect competition, the profit-maximizing output level is where:
questions.explanation: A firm maximizes profit where Marginal Revenue = Marginal Cost.

questions.question: If a firm's TR > TC at the profit-maximizing output, the firm is earning:
questions.explanation: When Total Revenue exceeds Total Cost, the firm earns an economic profit.

questions.question: In a perfectly competitive market, the Marginal Revenue curve is:
questions.explanation: In perfect competition, MR = Price, so the MR curve is a horizontal line at the market price.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent understanding of revenue, profit, and MR calculations.
scoreMessages.70: Good — review MR formulas and profit maximization rules.
scoreMessages.50: Fair — revisit TR = P×Q, π = TR−TC, and MR = ΔTR/ΔQ.
scoreMessages.0: Needs review: revenue and profit basics, MR in perfect competition.
